page.title: 04The Barn Evangelical Church
page.content: The Barn Evangelical Chapel started life as a barn belonging to a farmer called Foster. Foster Road was named because it was built on Mr. Foster's land and Harvey Road is named after his son. A ploughman John Raven first used it as a Chapel in 1822. It is built of lath, wood and plaster and the roof is thatched. Large beams in the barn are thought to originate from Maldon Barges. Inside, the chapel is plainly furnished with chairs, not pews. There is no choir. There are no stained windows. They now hold services four times a week but have no permanent minister. The youngest attender is six months old. This church practices adult baptism.
